Package ca.cgjennings.apps.arkham.project

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.cgjennings.apps.arkham.project.Member
      • ca.cgjennings.apps.arkham.project.Task
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IconProvider, Comparable<Member>, Iterable<Member>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TaskGroup
    public class Task
extends Member
    A task is kind of subproject within a project; the type of a task determines the kinds of actions that may be performed within it.
    Author:
    Chris Jennings

    • Method Detail

      • isTaskFolder

        public static boolean isTaskFolder​(File f)

      • getSettings

        public Settings getSettings()

      • createTask

        public static File createTask​(File parentFolder,
                              String taskName,
                              String taskType)
                       throws IOException
        Creates a new, empty task. If this succeeds, then the task can be opened using the returned file. This is a low-level method that creates the basic file structure for a task. To add a new task to a project, see TaskGroup.addNewTask(ca.cgjennings.apps.arkham.project.NewTaskType, java.lang.String).
        Parameters:
        parentFolder - the root project folder or a TaskGroup folder
        taskName - a name for the task
        taskType - a type descriptor for the project type
        Returns:
        the root folder of the task
        Throws:
        IOException - if the parent folder does not exist, or if it exists but has a child with the same name as the new task name, or if the task folder cannot be created for some reason
